list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Add GitHub Actions workflow for Selenium Test
A new workflow file was created in .github/workflow named work-flow.yml. This new file sets up a GitHub Actions workflow to automatically build and run Selenium tests upon every push to the main branch. It ensures consistent testing environment using GitHub's ubuntu-latest runner and Java 11. Committing this change will enforce these tests, improving overall code reliability.

task.summary:
Init Kotlin Selenium Test with
Introduced a new Selenium test to automate basic interactions on JetBrains site, including search and downloading. The test uses the Chrome WebDriver to simulate user actions, making assertions to validate the flow.
In addition, updated the .gitignore file to ignore certain files generated in the .idea directory, such as workspace settings and HTTP client requests. Thus, preventing unnecessary or sensitive data from being version controlled.

Init Kotlin Selenium Test with
Introduced a new Selenium test to automate basic interactions on JetBrains site, including search and downloading. The test uses the Chrome WebDriver to simulate user actions, making assertions to validate the flow.
In addition, updated the .gitignore file to ignore certain files generated in the .idea directory, such as workspace settings and HTTP client requests. Thus, preventing unnecessary or sensitive data from being version controlled.

"Refactor Selenium tests to follow Page Object Model pattern"
Refactored the Selenium tests to follow the Page Object Model pattern. The refactoring was done to make the tests more maintainable and understandable. Deleted the monolithic SeleniumTest.kt and broken it down into separate classes for each web page, such as HomePage and ResultPage, following the Page Object Model. Each page's properties and behaviours are encapsulated within its corresponding class, making the tests more organized and easier to comprehend. Also added support for various browser drivers in the config package and data used for testing is now stored in TestData class.

"Refactor Selenium tests for multiple browsers support"
This commit removes some unused Selenium test files and refactors the test suite to make it more flexible and usable across multiple browsers. The HomePage.kt, ResultPage.kt and TestData.kt have been deleted, as their functionalities have been moved and restructured.
In SeleniumTest.kt, a new function 'searchTest' has been created to encapsulate search related tests which can now be performed on any WebDriver instance. This allows the same tests to be reused across different browser drivers.
Also, a minor change in the ResultPage.kt file has been made for better test pass feedback by printing the page title when the test passes.

Add GitHub Actions workflow for Selenium Test
A new workflow file was created in .github/workflow named work-flow.yml. This new file sets up a GitHub Actions workflow to automatically build and run Selenium tests upon every push to the main branch. It ensures consistent testing environment using GitHub's ubuntu-latest runner and Java 11. Committing this change will enforce these tests, improving overall code reliability.

It ensures consistent testing environment using GitHub's ubuntu-latest runner and Java 11. Committing this change will enforce these tests, improving overall code reliability.
